name: hollow hill

attributes.attribute: region close to our world yet not part of it

sources: Monaghan, Patricia. The Encyclopedia of Celtic Mythology and Folklore. Checkmark Books, 2008.
text: Irish folklore presents the notion that some hills are hollow and serve as homes to Fairy palaces. This description of the Otherworld highlights its proximity to our reality while still being separate from it. One example of such a site is the hollow hill in Ireland.
